description: A metadata record has two sections, one with information for management of the metadata itself, and one that describes some individual resource. Each metadata record describes exactly one resource. The metadata record can be considered a representation of the resource, but it has an identity that is distinct from the identity of the described resource.  There may be more than one metadata record in the system describing a single resource, these should have distinct metadata lineages. specifications followed here-  JSON pointer--http: tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6901

MetadataRecord.description: information about the metadata record and link to resourceDescription

metadataRecordURI.description: unique identifier for the metadata record (as distinct from the resource it describes)

metadataUpdateDate.description: exactly 1. This is time stamp for most recent change to metadata content in this record. Update history should be in metadataLineage; this is a convienence property

metadataSpecification.description: Identifies the specification & profile for interpreting this document

metadataMaintenance.description: this element provides contact information for metadata maintainer and information on the maintenance interval and frequency. See metadataLineage for documentation of changes to the metadata record.

metadataLanguage.description: Language of metadata content. Default is eng if no value is specified.

metadataLineage.description: documentation of update history for this metadata record. In the CINERGI system, the lineage is externally maintained as provenance using PROV.

metadataUsageConstraint.description: documentation of any restrictions on access to or usage of the metadata record.

describedResource.description: exactly 1. what the metadata record is about

ResourceDescription.description: metadata that documents a resource. Basic requirement is title and access information to support the most basic discovery scenarios. The various optional elements provide capabilities for extensive resource documentation and inforamtion for machine interoperability.

resourceTitle.description: Title that identifies the resource for human users. Ideally the title would be unique to the described resource.

description.description: Free text description of the resource. May summarize intellectual content, as well as describe various metadata aspects such as lineage, quality, use constraints, maintenance.

resourceURI.description: Unique identifier conforming to IETF URI syntax (RFC 3986)

resourceContact.description: link to party to contact for additional information about the resource. Each relatedAgent has an associated role; various parties may be associated with the resource in different roles.

resourceType.description: 0..N.  ResourceType is a specially recognized keywordTheme that categorizes the resource; at least one type category should be specified, as the type will guide processing of other parts of the metadata record. Resource categorization can be done on many axes. Some example schemes include  Functional Requirements for Bibliographic Records (FRBR) entity, which include _work_,_expression_,_manifestation_, and _item_ (see http: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Functional_Requirements_for_Bibliographic_Records#FRBR_Entities), frbr form here as well ( e.g., novel, play, poem, essay, biography, symphony, concerto, sonata, map, drawing, painting, photograph, etc.), ISO scopeCodes that type resources. The different category schmes can be disambiguated by their VocabularyURI values, but concepts in each should have URIs that are sufficient.

status.description: Term that specifies the development status of the resource (in review, published, draft....)

browseGraphic.description: Reference that specifies a graphic resource that provides a visualization of the resource, as well as a URL link that should access the graphic.

temporalExtent.description: This is the time instant or interval to which the resource content applies. Extent using named time ordinal eras (e.g. geologic time) should be specified using temporal keywords (vocabulary is a time scale). use ISO8601 encoding for intervals with the format <start>/<end> where start and end are 8601 dateTime strings. see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601

resourceLanguage.description: Language of resource content. Multiple languages may be specified. Use Nil not applicable if there is no text in the resource.

resourceCitation.description: information to identify and locate published resources for which a formal bibliographic reference is appropriate.  Resource identifiers may include ISBN, ISSN, DeweyDecimal system numbers, or other URIs determined by the publishing authority.

citedResourceIdentifier.description: Other identifier(s) for the cited resource, e.g. ISBN, ISSN, Dewey Decimal system numbers, or other URIs determined by the publishing authority

date.description: Each date should scope a different origin event

fullCitation.description: a suggested full text citation to use when citing the resource; include standard bibliographic content like edition, publisher, series title, series issue, page numbers, other information appropriate to the described resource

spatialDescription.description: Properties characterizing the spatial aspects of the resource, if applicable. Allow multiple extents for non contiguous resource, e.g. map of US coasts.

spatialRepresentationType.description: term specifying the nature of the geometric representation, e.g. vector, grid, tin, voxel. More complete information on spatial representation (like ISO19115 spatial representation package) is not included here; use extensions in the description details group

spatialReferenceSystem.description: identifier and link to definition of spatial reference system used for location information contained in the resource content

keywordType.description: Categorize this group of keywords; corresponds to CSDGM and ISO19115 theme. Typical values: include place, temporal, thematic, ISO topic category etc...

keywords.description: words associated with the resource to improve search accuracy. if no keywordReference is provided, these will be treated as tags

keywordReference.description: identifies a thesaurus, controlled vocabulary, ontology, etc. in which the assigned keywords are defined for people and/or machines

accessOptions.description: describes how to access the resource described by the metadata. Corresponds to ISO19115 distribution

availableDateTime.description: identify dates or date ranges where there may be restrictions on access. 'event' term on each date should make it clear what the restriction is, e.g.  business hours ,  offline for maintenance ,  discontinued after...

distributor.description: agent responsible for making the resources accessible at the associated URLs or offline locations

accessURL.description: online location that provides some kind of access to the described resource. The link properties are used to characterize the nature of the resource at the specified location

accessInstructions.description: free text description of how to get resource;  Include turnaround time and business hours information, turnaround time, and any other necessary information, including density, density units, number of volumes, software or hardware requirements, etc.

fees.description: text explanation of any payment required to access resource

resourceMaintenance.description: only one here, because particular maintainence events that update the resource should be recorded in the lineage. This element provides information on how often maintenance is expected to occur and who is doing the maintenance. The resource maintenance contact will be the point of contact for reporting issues with the resource content.

relatedResources.description: links to related resources. The relation property on the link defines the association type, and the link label provides the related resource name

detailProperties.description: container for extension objects that define resource or domain-specific properties. Some basic examples are provided here

MaintenanceTemplate.description: Information about the maintenance plan and schedule for a resource. If the resource is updated, a process step in Lineage should be added.

maintenanceContact.description: contact information for the agent responsible for maintenance of the resource

maintenanceNote.description: free text information about maintenance plans, workflow, process...

maintenanceInterval.description: time interval between planned maintenance events e.g. 6 months

lineageStatement.description: free text description of provenance of resource and processing steps in its production

stepLabel.description: text to characterize,identify this step for user interface listing

sequence.description: number each step to put them in order. Order of listing in processing array is not significant

stepDateTime.description: allow array, may have beginning, end, intermediate times...

rationale.description: discussion of why the process step was done

processParameterValue.description: parameter value; profiles will need to define syntax for encoding units and non-scalar parameter values

processExtent.description: 0..N  scope process to a particular geographic location/locations. Only applicable to geospatial located dataset

affectedElement.description: references that identify dataset, entity, attribute instances affected by this process step

resultScopeEnumeration.description: list of references to items that the result applies to

qualityStatement.description: free text assessment of resource quality, including quantitative and qualitative measures. Abstract of a standaloneQualityReport should be included here.

standaloneQualityReport.description: reference that identifies a quality report document

qualityReport.description: a collection of quality elements that apply to the specified scope.

elementType.description: good starting point for this vocabulary is the subtypes of DQ_Element in ISO 19157: Completeness, conceptualConsistency, DomainConsistency, formatConsistency, topologicalConsistency,ThematicAccuracy, TemporalQuality, PositionalAccuracy (and subtypes of these...)

elementConfidence.description: general statement of confidence in this quality element assessment, guessing what the intention in 19157 is supposed to be

elementHomogeneity.description: how uniformly this element value applies across the assigned result scope

elementRepresentativity.description: degree to which the sample used has produced a result which is representative of the data within the data quality scope

measureIdentifier.description: Identifier of the measure, value uniquely identifying the measure within a namespace

measureLabel.description: Text label for users to understand measure type

evaluationType.description: links to reference docs for evaluation method should be in here. The methods should be mapped to the ISO19157 Evaluation method subtypes if possible; these include AggregationDerivation, IndirectEvaluation, SampleBAsedInspection, and FullInspection

evaluationMethodDescription.description: text description of the evaluation method

evaluationProcedure.description: text description of procedure used to implement evaluation method

qualityResultScopeEnumeration.description: list of references to items that the result applies to

resultValue.description: value may be single number or a list of numbers or strings

resultValueType.description: if value is a structured text string (implementing a record structure),link from concept URI should access a description of the record.

constraintsStatement.description: free text description of legal or security related constraint on access oto or use of the described resource

constraintTerm.description: a controlled concept that categorizes the constraint; may be a classificationCategory, accessConstraintCategory or useConstraintCategory

PublicationDetailsTemplate.description: title, date, identifier are inherited from context.Publication details will only apply if the describe resource is an frbr:expression or frbr:item. Linkage to online items should still be through distribution linkage elements.If the resource is a work or manifestation,then expressions and items will be distributions of that resource. Tricky...

publicationDescription.description: free text with other details specific to this particular manifestation of the resource.might add physicalDistribution elements here for library usage...

dataSchema.description: link to one or more resources describing the data schema

dataSetEntites.description: implements FGDC CSDGM entity-attribute section, and ISO19110 feature catalog. Array includes an entity count to indicate the number of instances of this entity in the described dataset instance

EntityTemplate.description: entity and attributes in the entity; ISO19110, ISO11179, FGDC entity - attribute information. Construct here describes concrete entities only.

entityReference.description: Reference.URI is used to link the entity defnition to other information. The entity defintion my be include by reference to an external resource.

entityType.description: feature dataset(collection of related geographic entities unified by spatial reference), relational table, object... Need to identify a good vocabulary of entity types. This is to bridge content models between ISO19110, ISO11179, and FGDC CSDGM

entityName.description: name of feature class, table,or other entity manifestation

aliasContext.description: identify the context in which the alias is used

memberEntity.description: compound entity like a feature dataset may have several included entities(lines and polys that have topological relationships). Don't try to model inheritance of properties in this scheme, denormalize and include references to repeated properties.

localName.description: name of attribute specific to context of this entity

entitySpatialReferenceSystem.description: SRS for feature class; only needs to be specified if have composite feature catalog for the dataset and feature classes using more that one SRS are included. If all uses one SRS, then the spatialResolution Property for the dataset is sufficient

spatialTopologyType.description: term specifying the topology type, i.e. the suite of relationships between feature that is enforced in the data

geometryType.description: the geometry of features in the entity: point, line, polygon, voxel

AttributeTemplate.description: basic properties to characterize attributes included in an entity content model

attributeReference.description: Reference.URI is used to link the attribute definition to other information. attribute definition may be by reference.

propertySpecified.description: The phenomenon quantified by the attribute, e.g.length, mass, concept, velocity.The value here will be related to the valid UOM for the value.

dataType.description: logical data type for attribute; 0..1, integer, float, text, URI, reference...

domain.description: specifiction of restrictions on the range of values that may be used to quantify the specified property

serviceDetailsTemplate.description: for metadata describing a service, the distribution section should include links to service end point URLs that will provide the service - specific self description document, e.g.THREDDS catalog, OGC GetCapabilities, OpenSearchDescription, WSDL, WADL, etc. This detail section allows linking to datasets exposed by the service, generic description of the operations provided by the service, and any important bindings between datasets and operations.It is anticipated that in most cases, this information will be gleaned from the service self - description document.Links to datasets are useful for discovery of services exposing particular datasets(which may be unknown to the dataset originator or metadata record creator

couplingType.description: tight, loose, or mixed, specifies the degree to which service operation is bound to a particular dataset

CoupledResources.description: operations specified in this section should not be duplicated in Operations section unless they may also be invoked in a loosely coupled mode

operation.description: name, identifier and links to registered operation; identifies the operation for interoperabiltiy and service composition workflows

operationType.description: one or more controlled terms that categorize the kind of operation to assist search/discovery

invocationName.description: name used to invoke operation in the context of the service

operationDescription.description: free text description of what operation does

invocationLink.description: one or more links for invoking operation. Suggest convention that in the link, strings that begin with $ and have names matching the InvocationName or a ParameterName can be treated as template slots that indicate where the invocation name and parameters should be inserted in the invocation URL.

parameterDescription.description: description of how to use parameter

gridDescription.description: text description of coverage gridding scheme

coverageDimensions.description: 1..N one instance for each coverage dimension

coverageGeoreferencingDescription.description: text description of how coverage grid is or may be georeferenced

coverageGeoreferenceStatus.description: Term to indicate the status of a coverage with respect to establishing georeferencing. Includes e.g. {georeferencable, georectified, georeferenced...}, for coverage that  could be georeferenced, coverage that is georectified such that grid points are regularly located in a geographic coordinate system, georefenced means that information is included with the coverage (e.g. file header or world file) that defines mapping between coverage grid and geographic location.

regularOrIrregular.description: term characterizing whether sample spacing on grid dimention is regularly spaced or irregular

spacing.description: spacing of samples on this dimension; if spacing is irregular, this is mean spacing

dimensionProperty.description: reference that specifies the phenomonon quantified on this coverage dimension

dimensionDomain.description: explanation of value domain for this axis

illuminationElevationAngle.description: illumination elevation measured in degrees clockwise from the target plane at intersection of the optical line of sight with the Earth's surface. For images from a scanning device, refer to the centre pixel of the image

illuminationAzimuthAngle.description: illumination azimuth measured in degrees clockwise from true north at the time the image is taken. For images from a scanning device, refer to the centre pixel of the image

compressionGenerationQuantity.description: count of the number of lossy compression cycles performed on the image

radiometricCalibration.description: identifier for resource representing a particular calibration event. Use reference because same calibration may be used over many images. Use nil/nilReason to explicitly document missing or unknown values.

cameraCalibration.description: identifier for resource representing a particular calibration event. Use reference because same calibration may be used over many images. Use nil/nilReason to explicitly document missing or unknown values.

filmDistortionInformation.description: identifier for resource representing a particular description of film distortion. Use reference because same inforamtion may be used over many images. Use nil/nilReason to explicitly document missing or unknown values.

lensDistortionInformation.description: identifier for resource representing description of distortion for a particular lense. Use reference because same lens characterization may be used over many images. Use nil/nilReason to explicitly document missing or unknown values.

SoftwareTemplate.description: this should be considered a rough draft of what might be useful...

harwareRequirements.description: text describing necessary hardware environment for software to execute

preconditions.description: text description of input requirements and state necessary to start execution

label.description: This should be in the language specified by metadataLanguage

altConceptContext.description: text that defines a context for use of this label

conceptLink.description: 0..N can provide various links to get related concepts, definitions, source, etc.

contactAddress.description: postal address,ideally formatted appropriate to the target country. One field because there is no clear reason to disaggregate the address into street, city, country, postal code, etc...

position.description: position of individual in context of an organization

info.description: one of these should be for an icon to represent the organization

extentLabel.description: string to label this extent in UI

extentURI.description: give extent an identity, could create a catalog of extents

extentReference.description: extent could be associated by reference (i.e. by providing its URI), but only useful in a system that could follow links to access the actual geometry.

boundingBoxWGS84.description: simplest representation of geographic extent using latitude and longitude coordinates. Points are represented as degenerate boxes (east = west, north = south bound). Mandate WGS 84 for interoperability. For boxes in polar regions, recommend using geometry property, which allows specification of other SRS appropriate to polar region.

geometry.description: allow arbitrary geometry object to specify extent. Use GeoJSON encoding. Schema by fge on Github

items.description: arbitrary GeoJSON object; include cRS information in the GeoJSON

LinkTemplate.description: used for situations that need a link to an online resource, typically for navigating linked data space.

link.description: a web-derferencable identifier that locates the link target; typically an HTTP URI. URI syntax specifies that the identifier string includes a prefix that specifies the base protocol for the identifier

relation.description: Term from IANA rel vocabulary for consistency with IETF5988

title.description: text to label this link in a UI

resourceType.description: typically use MIME type string from IANA registry http : //www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/application/index.html. This is the type of the file that will be accessed directly by the link URL; if this is a container file (e.g. zip archive), the innerResourceType property is used to specify the type of file with actual resource content.

innerResourceType.description: File type for the actual resource content. Typically use MIME type string from IANA registry http : //www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/application/index.html

overlayAPI.description: Reference that identifies the API for messages tunneled to a component on the target server.  Optional, provide if such scheme or protocol is necessary to utilize the link. The URI should be defined by the service specification for the protocol or service type; version information should be included if applicable.  E.g. OGC WMS, WS-services. This property is typically used for services that encode remote procedure calls using identifiers dereferenced using standard HTTP methods (GET, POST).

profile.description: Identifier for profile of specifications identified by type, overlayAPI, and template attributes. Optional, provide if additional conventions are necessary for content contained in messages through this link. Note that the same output scheme might be encoded using different types. Profiles typically add usage conventions when the interchange scheme offers alternate approaches, restrict cardinality for elements in the interchange format, or specify usage of particular vocabularies.

linkParameterName.description: string to display, and identifier to link parameter to registry

description.description: free text description of the target to help UI

transferSize.description: advisory length of the linked content in octets

linkModifier.description: term (controlled concept or URI?) that characterize the link or expected behavior, analogous to xlink:actuate. Some compiled terms include noFollow, new, replace, embed, onLoad, onRequest, noReferrer, prefetch //0..N

ReferenceTemplate.description: use when another external linked data resource is intended to be the value of some element. The URI is proxy for that resource, such that text-based identifier comparison can be used when convienent. The associated links are for advertising specific representations or related resources. Some of these are likely to be accessible by dereferncing the URI, but the link elements allow explicit indication of the available representations and how to get them (with no URI redirection...)

referenceLabel.description: text to identify the reference in a UI

referenceLinks.description: Links to representation of some referenced resource

eventType.description: 0..N  event may be categorized in various ways...

ValueDomainTemplate.description: choice of one of the following elements:

controlledVocabulary.description: attribute value is restricted to terms from a vocabulary (pick list)

targetEntity.description: if attribute value is link to another entity. The URI identifies an entity type definition, and the reference links should enable access to the linked resource in a specific instance.

stringLength.description: if datatype is text, max lenght of text string
